topic.title: Secure Shell Keys
topic.shortdesc: Password-less SSH access for the root user from the administration node and the Cloudera Manager node (usually the HA node) is required to access all nodes in the cluster for Cloudera Manager installation

ol.li:
Create the public and private keys by running the following command on all nodes as the root user:ssh-keygen
The public keys for each machine will reside on those machines in the ~/.ssh/ directory, and are named according to the type of encryption that is chosen (i.e., id_rsa.pub).
Copy the pubic key from the administration node, and the Cloudera Manager node, to all nodes in the cluster.
Append the key to the ~/.ssh/authorized_keys file on each of the nodes.
